title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2.3 - Executive Order No. 3: Relating to extended unemployment insurance benefits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2.3 - Executive Order No. 3: Relating to extended unemployment insurance benefits

State Regulations
I, Malcolm Wilson, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by subdivision 6 of section
601
of the Labor Law
upon the advice of the Industrial Commissioner and the Commissioner of

Commerce, do hereby direct by executive order that the applicability of the
provisions of item (ii) of subparagraph (1) of paragraph (b) of subdivision 1
of section
601
of the Labor Law, and of the reference to such item in subparagraph (2) of such paragraph, is
suspended until March 31, 1974, having determined that such suspension is
required in order to assure adequate payment of benefits to unemployed workers
in the State who are experiencing unemployment for an extended duration. Signed: Malcolm A. Wilson

Dated: February 1, 1974

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
